OOC: Well, I believe in evolution and a greater power but not the Bible. Ev=
eryone will believe things their own way...

  ----- Original Message -----=
 
  From: Vryl The Cranberry Hag 
  To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Sat=
urday, December 28, 2002 6:56 PM
  Subject: Re: Merry Christmas!


  OOC: T=
his isn't really a NBW topic, but while we're on the subject, I would like =
to put my two cents in.

  If you belive in evolution, there are major flaw=
s in that theory.  It trys to explain things with science that shouldn't be=
 explained with science.  You cannot scientiffycally prove wiether or not t=
he spiritual realm exists.

  But partial creationism is foolishness.  If y=
ou are following the biblical account of creation, there is no room for int=
erperatation.  The Bible tells you when it is being symbolic by using words=
 as: "like" "as" but when it refers to creation, it doesn't.  You cannot in=
terperet on it's own; the rest of scriptures back this up.

  If God has th=
e power to create something from nothing, then why would he only set it in =
motion?  Wouldn't he rather be involved in the project?

  Anyway, It's ok =
to be a "radical" if you can use your head.
  >Message: 1
  >   Date: Fri, =
27 Dec 2002 12:18:39 -0800 (PST)
  >   From: Kyle Stewart <dewboy30816@yaho=
o.com>
  >Subject: Re: Merry Christmas!
  >
  >I know it's a little late, b=
ut I meant to do this on
  >Christmas eve/day:
  >
  >Oh come, oh come Emaa=
anuel,
  >and ransom captive Iiisreal,
  >which mourns in lonely eeeexile h=
ere,
  >until the son of Goood appears,
  >rejoice, rejoice, Emaaanuel,
  >=
shall come to thee oh Iiisreal.
  >
  >.....*sigh* o.k. just get it over wi=
th, start with the
  >anti-religious flames because you falsely believe me
=
  >to be a radical.  Believe it or not I've often
  >defended such losing c=
auses as evolution in the name
  >of partial creationism (it means God work=
ed THROUGH
  >evolution and the seven days were symbolic)....o.k.
  >you ca=
n flame me about that to, but like it or not
  >evolution currently IS a lo=
sing cause, why, because
  >there are NO holes in creationism, it's to simp=
le to
  >find holes in, just God made everything in a few days
  >and every=
thing looked old even then, so while
  >evolution in my opinion is just as =
legitimate,
  >whenever a tiny hole appears the pure creationists can
  >be=
at both pure evolutionists and us partial
  >creationists over the head wit=
h it for two or three
  >decades until ninty percent of the world is on the=
re
  >side.
  >  My defense of partial creationism against pure
  >evolutio=
nism is simple though.  Before the Big Bang,
  >how did the so-called "prim=
ortial atom" get there.  I
  >mean infinately dense particals billions of t=
imes
  >smaller than normal atoms don't usually just pop out
  >of nowhere =
do they.  The only person I've ever heard
  >answer that was some nutcase a=
stronomer who said
  >aliens from another dimension wanted to do a science
=
  >project and overloaded a black hole to start the big
  >bang, but then y=
ou can simply ask how did THEIR
  >primortial atom get there, and yes I do =
believe the
  >stories about alien abductions, but not that one.
  >
  >---=
 "Nic <wingedwarrior41@...>"
  ><wingedwarrior41@...> wrote=
:
  >> Merry Christmas everybody and may your wishes come
  >> true! Unless=
 they
  >> include someone's death, especially mine... :O
  >>
